edu.rit.util

Class Searching

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.Searching

  • public class Searching
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Searching provides static methods for searching arrays of primitive types and object types.

    Note: The operations in class Searching are not multiple thread safe.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Searching.Byte
      Class Searching.Byte is the base class for a helper object used to search an array of type byte[].
      static class  Searching.Character
      Class Searching.Character is the base class for a helper object used to search an array of type char[].

    • Method Detail

      • searchUnsorted

        public static int searchUnsorted(byte[] x,
                 byte a)
        Search the given unordered array of type byte[] for the given element. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

      • searchUnsorted

        public static int searchUnsorted(byte[] x,
                 int off,
                 int len,
                 byte a)
        Search a portion of the given unordered array of type byte[] for the given element. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x[off] through x[off+len-1], then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchUnsorted

        public static int searchUnsorted(byte[] x,
                 byte a,
                 Searching.Byte helper)
        Search the given unordered array of type byte[] for the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for equality only. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

      • searchUnsorted

        public static int searchUnsorted(byte[] x,
                 int off,
                 int len,
                 byte a,
                 Searching.Byte helper)
        Search a portion of the given unordered array of type byte[] for the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for equality only. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x[off] through x[off+len-1], then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchSorted

        public static int searchSorted(byte[] x,
               byte a)
        Search the given ordered array of type byte[] for the given element. It is assumed that the array is sorted in ascending order; otherwise, the searchSorted() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

      • searchSorted

        public static int searchSorted(byte[] x,
               int off,
               int len,
               byte a)
        Search a portion of the given ordered array of type byte[] for the given element. It is assumed that the array is sorted in ascending order; otherwise, the searchSorted() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x[off] through x[off+len-1], then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchSorted

        public static int searchSorted(byte[] x,
               byte a,
               Searching.Byte helper)
        Search the given ordered array of type byte[] for the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the helper object; otherwise, the searchSorted() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

      • searchSorted

        public static int searchSorted(byte[] x,
               int off,
               int len,
               byte a,
               Searching.Byte helper)
        Search a portion of the given ordered array of type byte[] for the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the helper object; otherwise, the searchSorted() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x[off] through x[off+len-1], then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchInterval

        public static int searchInterval(byte[] x,
                 byte a)
        Search the given ordered array of type byte[] for an interval containing the given element. It is assumed that the array is sorted in ascending order; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[0], then i = 0 is returned. If x[x.length-1] ≤ a, then i = x.length is returned. If x is zero length, then i = −1 is returned.

      • searchInterval

        public static int searchInterval(byte[] x,
                 int off,
                 int len,
                 byte a)
        Search a portion of the given ordered array of type byte[] for an interval containing the given element. It is assumed that the array is sorted in ascending order; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[off], then i = off is returned. If x[off+len-1] ≤ a, then i = off+len is returned. If len = 0, then i = −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchInterval

        public static int searchInterval(byte[] x,
                 byte a,
                 Searching.Byte helper)
        Search the given ordered array of type byte[] for an interval containing the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the helper object; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[0], then i = 0 is returned. If x[x.length-1] ≤ a, then i = x.length is returned. If x is zero length, then i = −1 is returned.

      • searchUnsorted

        public static int searchUnsorted(char[] x,
                 char a)
        Search the given unordered array of type char[] for the given element. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

      • searchUnsorted

        public static int searchUnsorted(char[] x,
                 int off,
                 int len,
                 char a)
        Search a portion of the given unordered array of type char[] for the given element. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x[off] through x[off+len-1], then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

      • searchInterval

        public static int searchInterval(int[] x,
                 int a)
        Search the given ordered array of type int[] for an interval containing the given element. It is assumed that the array is sorted in ascending order; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[0], then i = 0 is returned. If x[x.length-1] ≤ a, then i = x.length is returned. If x is zero length, then i = −1 is returned.

      • searchInterval

        public static int searchInterval(int[] x,
                 int off,
                 int len,
                 int a)
        Search a portion of the given ordered array of type int[] for an interval containing the given element. It is assumed that the array is sorted in ascending order; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[off], then i = off is returned. If x[off+len-1] ≤ a, then i = off+len is returned. If len = 0, then i = −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

        public static int searchInterval(float[] x,
                 int off,
                 int len,
                 float a,
                 Searching.Float helper)
        Search a portion of the given ordered array of type float[] for an interval containing the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the helper object; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[off], then i = off is returned. If x[off+len-1] ≤ a, then i = off+len is returned. If len = 0, then i = −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchInterval

        public static int searchInterval(FloatList x,
                 float a,
                 Searching.Float helper)
        Search the given ordered float list for an interval containing the given element. The given helper object is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the helper object; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x.get(i-1) ≤ a < x.get(i). If a < x.get(0), then i = 0 is returned. If x.get(x.size()-1) ≤ a, then i = x.size() is returned. If x is empty, then i = −1 is returned.

                 double a)
        Search the given unordered array of type double[] for the given element. An O(n) linear search algorithm is used.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        Returns:
        If an element the same as a exists in x, then the index of that element is returned. Otherwise, −1 is returned.

        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        helper - Helper object.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[off], then i = off is returned. If x[off+len-1] ≤ a, then i = off+len is returned. If len = 0, then i = −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.

      • searchInterval

        public static <T> int searchInterval(T[] x,
                     T a,
                     java.util.Comparator<T> comp)
        Search the given ordered array of type T[] for an interval containing the given element. The given comparator is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the comparator; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Array element data type.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        comp - Comparator.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[0], then i = 0 is returned. If x[x.length-1] ≤ a, then i = x.length is returned. If x is zero length, then i = −1 is returned.

      • searchInterval

        public static <T> int searchInterval(T[] x,
                     int off,
                     int len,
                     T a,
                     java.util.Comparator<T> comp)
        Search a portion of the given ordered array of type T[] for an interval containing the given element. The given comparator is used to compare elements for order and equality. It is assumed that the array is sorted in the order determined by the comparator; otherwise, the searchInterval() method's behavior is not specified. An O(log n) binary search algorithm is used.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Array element data type.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be searched.
        off - Index of first element to be searched.
        len - Number of elements to be searched.
        a - Element to be searched for.
        comp - Comparator.
        Returns:
        An index i such that x[i-1] ≤ a < x[i]. If a < x[off], then i = off is returned. If x[off+len-1] ≤ a, then i = off+len is returned. If len = 0, then i = −1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > x.length.
